title: Minister of Trade addresses Red Rice shortage, blames past policies
byline: Minister of Trade, Commerce and Food Security Wasantha Samarasinghe stated that the current shortage of Red Rice in the market emerged as a result of mismanagement by previous governments, while assuring the public that measures are being taken to address the situation.

title: Over 100 evacuated due to risk of Gal Oya river bunds breaching
byline: Over 100 individuals from more than 25 families in Senanayakapura and Samapura in Ampara, have been evacuated to safer locations due to the risk of the Gal Oya river bunds breaching, according to the Ampara District Secretary.

title: Sri Lanka hopes for more Chinese tourists: Deputy Minister
byline: “I have traveled almost all over China, and get impressed by the beauty of the diverse culture, food and friendly people. I also hope that more Chinese tourists will come to my country to experience Sri Lanka’s scenery and culture,” Ruwan Ranasinghe, Deputy Minister of Foreign Affairs, Foreign Employment and Tourism of Sri Lanka told Xinhua.

title: Thailand reiterates commitment to rescue Sri Lankan human trafficking victims in Myanmar
byline: The Ambassador and Permanent Representative of Sri Lanka to Thailand, Wijayanthi Edirisinghe has called on Chatchai Bangchuad, Secretary-General of the National Security Council (NSC) of Thailand recently.

title: President Dissanayake to meet Chinese counterpart tomorrow
byline: Sri Lanka’s President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently undertaking a 4-day state visit in China will meet the Chinese President Xi Jinping on Wednesday (14), the President’s Media Division (PMD) said.

title: Two Chinese nationals arrested at BIA with gems worth over Rs. 17 mln
byline: A group of officers of Sri Lanka Customs has apprehended a Chinese national father and his daughter over their attempt to smuggle a stock of gemstones out of the country.
